extendedInfo.description: Cardcloud is the only business card you'll ever need.Log into your existing Cardcloud account or sign up directly by creating your first card. You can do this by selecting your existing contact information from your phone's address book, or by entering the info manually.Cardcloud allows you to create multiple cards. This way, you can have share info with business contacts, or rather have a personal card to send out. Freelancers working for multiple companies can create as many cards as they want. You can edit contact information, profile pictures, logos, and social networking profiles for each card you create.Recipients donât have to have Cardcloud installed on their phone. You can send your card directly to an email address, and Cardcloud will deliver a beautifully formatted card directly to the recipient's inbox. You can also beam your card directly to other Cardcloud users in the vicinity, and store contact information on your phoneâs address book.Cardcloud allows you to remember more about your new contacts. For each exchange, information is stored about the person you met. Remember who you met when, where and how. See where you met. Add a note. Was it at a conference, or perhaps a trade fair? Cardcloud takes your cards to the next level.

reviews.title: Linkedin Network doesn\'t work
reviews.comment: I have a Samsung Galaxy S3 and when I try to add Linked In as a social service, I get the error that certain symbols cannot be used.  The problem is that the basic Linked In username is your email address which everyone\'s email contains the \"@\" symbol.    Also, I cannot seem to add a picture to the business card using the phone app.  I can only add it using the web application.    Finally, since each field is not tagged, when sharing the card with business associates, all the information does not appear in their contact manager, such as Outlook.  The phone numbers do not transfer over.  In order for this to work, I believe each field must be tagged with business, mobile, home, etc, for outlook to assign the number.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Droid razr
reviews.comment: Great Idea but won\'t let me add country or even sign up. Please fix so I can use this awesome app
reviews.author: Chris Sposeto

reviews.title: gone badly downhill!
reviews.comment: Just installed on new phone - can\'t sign in! What\'s going on? Fix or take down guys!  Xperia SP
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Sign In & Sign Up don\'t work
reviews.comment: On my Galaxy Note 2, I was unable to sign up using all methods; manual, linkedin & facebook. Had to register on web. After that, I\'m unable to Sign In. Frustrated.
reviews.author: Imran Raheem

reviews.title: Abandoned?
reviews.comment: Did these guys abandon this app? No recent updates and still cannot sign in on my device. Really liked this app too :-\\
reviews.author: Adrian Cepeda

reviews.title: Is CardCloud down for mobile?
reviews.comment: I\'m a frequent user of CardCloud but recently I\'m unable to connect using my mobile device and that\'s the whole point of having CardCloud, because it\'s mobile. Is the app down? I\'m still able to send from my laptop, but not my Droid. I will wait till the end of this month then I\'ll have to use another app....
reviews.author: Howard Yoshino

reviews.title: App not working
reviews.comment: I would jump this to 5 stars if the app worked! Everything about the app is great, from the ease of use, to the functionality & \"card\" customization. However, now I get an error: \"Cardcloud can\'t connect to the internet right now.\" This happens despite being connected 4G. The bigger problem is the lack of response from Cloudcard support in trying to resolve it.  So a non-working app gets 1 star.
reviews.author: Mark Ezrin

reviews.title: Really disappointed now
reviews.comment: I\'ve never had a problem with the application until today an important person asked for my card and the app was not connecting to the internet even though I had 4g I wrote down his email and was embarrassed idk if he will even consider my business now so unprofessional
reviews.author: Jerome Dallas

reviews.title: Not working
reviews.comment: Unable to log in on Nexus 7, this app used to be awesome.......

reviews.title: Pretty slick

reviews.title: Like it...
